channel.title: Need help with putting a command at the quest tab
channel.description: Alright, i want to add a command to the quest tab. I mean if i go to a quest tab and then (example : clicking on melee set ) Should it spawn a melee set. Please link me to a simple guide or just post a simple guide here! Thanks ;D

item.title: Need help with putting a command at the quest tab

item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

No problem man tell me if you have new problems about other stuff.

item.title: Need help with putting a command at the quest tab
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Most of the PI’s sendMessage about the information the player clicking for me (allstar/delta) i have added this:
sendMessage("Case 185: action button: "+actionButtonId);
sendMessage(“Error, cannot continue this. (case 185)”);
sends it only if the button is unknown. (switch statemant)
EDIT: i can post here some of the buttons ID maybe it will work on [PI]'s too.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with putting a command at the quest tab

Thanks for now

Sorry for this weird questions

Im new to the Quest tab section
Sh0ck

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with putting a command at the quest tab

item.title: Need help with putting a command at the quest tab
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

I am sorry i dont know about PI’s but i can try to help you. in your quest tab, you have a text? if so search the text in one of your java files (sorry i dont know where) and change it, now for the clicking i dont know, but i can post here how i do it in delta server, look:
i have a void called “loadquestinterface”
inside i have this:

if(q2stage >= 1) { sendQuest("@yel@Add special attack", 7333); } if(q2stage == 0) { sendQuest("@yel@Add special attack", 7333); }
i should clean a little bit so dont notice the q2stage (used for quests).
Ok so now i have the text in my quest tab. i can add the button clicking look how:
case 28165 is the cook’s assistant button id.

case 28165:

break;

inside you do what you want.
maybe it will direct you to [PI]'s codes.

Read full topic
